g.text: Fan-out: Maximum number of loads that can be driven
tPLH: Propagation delay Low to High
• Output changes from LOW to HIGH
tPHL: Propagation delay High to Low
• Output changes from HIGH to LOW
Depends on technology and operating conditions
Fan-in | Max inputs per gate | 2-8 | Gate complexity, speed
Fan-out | Max loads per output | 10-50 | Driving capability
Noise Margin | Immunity to noise | 0.4-2.5V | System reliability
Prop. Delay | Gate switching time | 1-50 ns | System speed
Power Diss. | Energy consumption | 1-100 mW | Heat, battery life
Figure Merit | Speed-power product | 0.1-500 pJ | Overall efficiency
Faster gates typically consume more power
Better noise immunity often means slower operation
